1.text: To get your vehicle out of a skid, you should first:

answers.text: Steer in the direction you want to go.
Steer in the opposite direction of the skid.

1.explanation: To get your vehicle out of a skid, you should first steer in the direction you want to go.

2.text: When may you lend your driver’s licence?

answers.text: To a person learning to drive.

2.explanation: You should not lend your driver’s license.

3.text: What must a driver do before entering a highway from a private road or driveway?

answers.text: Yield right-of-way to all vehicles approaching on the highway.
Enter or cross the highway as quickly as possible.
Sound horn and proceed with caution.
Give hand signal then take right-of-way.

3.explanation: Before entering a highway from a private road or driveway a driver must yield right-of-way to all vehicles approaching on the highway.

4.text: Never change lanes in traffic without:

answers.text: Giving proper signal and looking to make sure the move can be made safely.
Looking in the rear view mirror only.
Blowing your horn and looking to the rear.
Decreasing speed and giving correct signal.

4.explanation: When changing lanes in traffic always give the proper signal and look to make sure your move can be made safely.

5.text: When the driver of another vehicle is about to overtake and pass your vehicle, you must:

answers.text: Move to the right and allow such vehicle to pass.
Speed up so that passing is not necessary.
Move to the left to prevent passing.
Signal to the other driver not to pass.

5.explanation: When the driver of another vehicle is about to overtake and pass your vehicle, you must move to the right and allow his/her vehicle to pass.

6.text: When you are deciding whether or not to make a U-turn, your first consideration should be to check:

answers.text: Presence of trees, fire hydrants or poles near the curb.

6.explanation: When you are deciding whether or not to make a U-turn, your first consideration should be to check the traffic regulations.

7.text: It is more dangerous to drive at the maximum speed limit at night than during daytime as:

answers.text: You cannot see as far ahead at night.
Your reaction time is slower at night.
Some drivers unlawfully drive with parking lights only.
The roadways are more apt to be slippery at night.

7.explanation: It is more dangerous to drive at the maximum speed limit at night than during the daytime because you cannot see as far ahead at night.

8.text: You should under all conditions drive at a speed which will allow you to:
8.explanation: Under all conditions you should drive at a speed that will allow you to stop within a safe distance

9.text: At what times must a driver accompany you in the front passenger seat if you are driving with a learner's license?
9.explanation: When you are you are driving with a learner's license, a graduated driver must accompany you in the front passenger seat all the time.

10.text: In what amount of time must you inform the Ministry of Transportation if a licensed driver changes their name or address?

answers.text: At any time prior to the license renewal date

10.explanation: When you as a licensed driver change your name or address you must inform the Ministry of Transportation within 6 days.

11.text: If there is median on the road, when do you need to stop for a school bus?

answers.text: If you are behind it and it has red lights flashing

11.explanation: If you are behind it and it has red lights flashing.

12.text: What does having an Accessible Parking Permit do?

answers.text: A vehicle carrying the person to whom it was issued to use a designated disabled parking space
A designated parking space to be used by any vehicle showing the permit
The holder’s family members to use designated spaces

12.explanation: A vehicle carrying the person to whom it was issued to use a designated disabled parking space.

13.text: How much visibility do you need to be able to make a U-turn?

14.text: How much authority do signs giving instructions around roadwork have?

15.text: If you fail to stay at the scene of an accident, how many points could you get on your license?

16.text: What is the area that you are unable to see in your rear and side-view mirrors?

17.text: What does overdriving your headlights mean?

answers.text: Driving so fast that your stopping distance is farther than you can see with your headlights
Driving with high beam headlights at all times

17.explanation: Driving so fast that your stopping distance is farther than you can see with your headlights.

18.text: What does a red X over a driving lane mean?

answers.text: A driver must not enter or remain in that lane
Drivers in that lane must stop immediately

18.explanation: A driver must not enter or remain in that lane.

19.text: If you are exiting a freeway, what should you do?

answers.text: Signal, move into the deceleration lane, reduce speed gradually and obey exit signs
Signal and then stop to wait for an opening in traffic
Do what the vehicle ahead of you does
Signal, and then accelerate while merging smoothly into traffic and then proceed to the exit lane

19.explanation: Signal, move into the deceleration lane, reduce speed gradually and obey exit signs.

20.text: If your brakes fail, what should you do?

answers.text: Pump the brakes rapidly and shift into a lower gear
Wave down the nearest police officer and shout for help
Firmly press down on your brakes until they re-engage
Use your emergency brake and sound your horn to warn other drivers while looking for a soft collision point

20.explanation: Pump the brakes rapidly and shift into a lower gear.
